[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

PLEASE NOTE (2017): Due to recent false accusations of plagarism, I (the reviewer) would like to stress that all these reviews and upcoming reviews are original and are not blatantly copied. Other reviews are used to help stress my point across but are changed in such a way to make the review in my own wording [/h1]

[b] THE SEQUEL THAT CHANGED EVERYTHING... YET AGAIN! [/b]

This game is still awesome and fun to play even to this day, Half-Life 2 still stays one of the best FPS games on the PC. Released way back in 2004, Half-Life 2 was developed by Valve and originally published by Sierra Studios but now is self-published by Valve themselves and is the sequel to the widely popular Half-Life

Half-Life 2 offers solid controls with an interestingly told story and some interesting settings and unforgettable characters. The game is difficult and you will die a lot but with a little patience you will get through its 8 or so hour campaign

Half-Life 2 offers some good level design with a modding community which is still alive to this very day! And the game runs smoothly and runs fine on modern-day systems

And who of course forget the famous crowbar!

Incredibly, for a game that came out in 2004, the game's graphics and sound deisgn have really aged well and you can tell if the game came out nowadays or in 2004 and with the Source engine, it has aged the game very well and has made it playable on almost every modern PC to date

Half-Life 2 is an instant classic sequel and a must buy for every PC owner!
 
[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!) [/i]

This sequel to the original Half-Life, came out in 2004 and is a superb FPS classic. The graphics are still impressive for today's standards and the story narrative immerses the player into the role of protagonist Gordon Freeman. There is a great selection of weapons ranging from the iconic crowbar all the way through the object-manipulating Gravity Gun. An excellent addition to any Half-Life franchise gamer's collection!
Simple analisis, jugaria esto un millon de veces.

HALF-LIFE 3 CONFIRMED!!!!!

I would give this game five thumbs up. It's great and fun and original, but it's not "the best fps game ever" like I heard it was. An FPS game has so much variability in it, that it is hard and dangerous to ever make such a call. That would be like saying Pizza is the best food ever. You may really like it, but what about that feeling you get when you really want a hamburger? Pizza can never replace that. There is a time and a place for everything, and this game is good for when you want to play an adventure/story game by yourself. This game is definitely not as scary as other FPS games I've played, but it has made me jump before. Overall, this is a very good game, and I would recommend it to any FPS fan.
Top notch

After years of loving and enjoying this game and many recommendations to friends, I feel like it is time to make a full on review after my latest playthrough of the series.

The only proper way to start this review is to give my background with the Half-Life series. I first found out about this game in 2011 after playing though Portal and Portal 2. I got the game late one night and immediately fell in love after a few hours. I loved every second of this game (except for a low point I will mention later). After playing this game, I played the episodes and later went back to play HL1.
Now for a proper review:

Story: Incredible. The opening of this game scared the s h i t out of me the first night I played and left me troubled to sleep. Beyond that, the game's basic story, while a simple "kill the dictator" story at it's base, has so much going on in the background with the mystery of what the combine are, to the betrayal, to the unique and interesting side characters and aliens, this game has it all. A single shortcoming storywise is the strange worship of Gordon Freeman like a god. For some reason everyone knows exactly who Gordon Freeman is, even before he starts the actual revolution, and it's kinda strange. Final Score: 9/10

Gameplay: Very Good. This game plays like a normal FPS, and that would make sense considering that the original Half-Life innovated the FPS as we know it today. The thing that propels (get it) this game out of the area of average is the Gravity Gun. It's so fun to be able to grab any objects you can find and fling them at your enemies. One thing that majorly drives this portion down though is one section of the game: Nova Prospekt. I personally believe that this is the weakest section in any HL game, and it's gonna drive this score down a whole ranking, from an 8 to a 7, just because of how boring it is. The most entertaining thing you can do in this portion of the game is take a friendly turret with you through the whole thing. Otherwise, the gameplay is pretty great. One more complaint though: Flashlight being tied to your oxygen/ sprint meter. This was a really dumb idea, and even a step back from HL1. Glad to see that fixed in episode 2. Final Score: 7/10.

Finally, Presentation: Great. Graphically, this game looked absolutely stunning compared to most games from 2004, and its graphics still hold up today. The game lacks any graphical fads of the time (like lens flares from the 2010s and such things) and this helps to keep it looking good today. The hud is very effective without taking up too much space, or having anything unneeded displayed. The fact that they toned down how often the suit talks works very much in this game's favor, as it was kind of annoying in HL1, having it speak every time you collected a suit battery. The whole asthetic within the city is great, and has a very distopian feel without seeming copied from other works. Each section of the game has it's own specific feel, and it really makes this game feel like a journey. Overall, the game is presented very well, and was revolutionary for it's time in that respect, but it still holds up today. Final Score: 8/10

Half-Life is probably my favorite video game series, and while I'm sad that we haven't seen a conclusion to the current story arc, I trust that when it comes out it's going to be incredible. I'm glad that Valve is a company that takes time with their games, and works to make sure that their games are not only really fun to play, but leave a lasting effect on the games industry as a whole. I hope that the new game comes out soon and does really well so that the rest of the triple A companies will realize that taking your time on a game does work. Anyway, with that rant over, my final score for 
Half-Life 2 is an 8/10. This is one of my favorite games ever, but it's obviously not perfect.

LA PTM EL MEJOR JUEGO EVER :V

The day will come, when at E3 you will see but a single chair and small table with a dinner plate on it bearing steak and asparagus. There will be a glass of wine. The room will be almost dark, except for one beam of light upon the chair and table. Gabe will slowly walk out onto stage, completely ignoring the audience and those around him. He will walk over, sit down. Place his napkin in his lap, and pick up his utensils. With an utter disregard for those around him, he will begin to eat. He will spend the next 5 or so minutes enjoying his luscious meal. He will finish eating, take a sip of his wine, and then stand up. Without a single ounce of acknowledgment, Gabe will slowly walk off stage, and out of sight.
